name: Blood Services
description: All blood for transfusion is tested for evidence of certain infectious disease pathogens, such as hepatitis B and C viruses and human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)

name: Dental Services
description: Dental care is the maintenance of healthy teeth and may refer to: Oral hygiene, the practice of keeping the mouth and teeth clean in order to prevent dental disorders.

name: Physiotherapy
description: Treatment of disease, injury, or deformity by physical methods such as massage, heat treatment, and exercise rather than by drugs or surgery.

name: Radiology
description: Radiology is a medical specialty that uses imaging to diagnose and treat diseases seen within the body using X-Ray

name: Surgical Services
description: Any service in a hospital or medical centre that is procedure- or intervention-based, or supports surgical specialties

name: Paediatric Services
description: Branch of medicine dealing with the health and medical care of infants, children, and adolescents from birth up to the age of 18. The word “paediatrics” means “healer of children”

name: Nursing Services
description: Nursing services implement the physicians’ plan of care and provides nursing care for the patients’ assessed needs.

name: Emergency
description: A medical emergency is an acute injury or illness that poses an immediate risk on a patient for life or for long-term health
